Introduction.content:
Between 2 and 5 years, your child grows fast, starts talking a lot, runs, jumps and learns everything like a sponge.

*What you feed them now decides if they will be strong, clever, tall and healthy when they go to school – and for the rest of their life.*

Good nutrition is simple and cheap: just give the same family food, but make sure every plate has foods from all groups every day. No packets, no special expensive foods needed.

Chapter 1: How Much Should a 2–5 Year Ol.content:
### Daily Meals
- 3 main meals (breakfast, lunch, dinner)
- 2 healthy snacks (mid-morning + afternoon)
= **5 eating times every day**

### Portion Guide (use child’s own plate)
- 2–3 years → fill ¾ of a normal plate
- 4–5 years → fill a full normal plate

Let the child stop when full – never force the plate to be empty.

Chapter 2: The Perfect Plate Every Meal.content:
Every breakfast, lunch and dinner must have these 4 things:
1. **Staple food** (energy) – ugali, rice, matoke, chapati, stiff porridge, sweet potato
2. **Protein** (growth & strength) – egg, fish, chicken, meat, beans, dagaa, groundnuts
3. **Vegetables** (protection & eyesight) – mchicha, cabbage, kunde, carrots, tomatoes
4. **Fruit** (vitamins & strong teeth) – banana, mango, orange, watermelon, avocado

Add 1–2 teaspoons of oil or groundnut paste for healthy brain fat.

Chapter 3: Super Foods to Give Every Day.content:
- **Eggs** – at least 4–7 per week (cheapest brain food)
- **Milk or yogurt** – 2–3 cups daily
- **Dark green vegetables** – mchicha, sukuma wiki, managu (every single day)
- **Dagaa or small fish** – 3–4 times a week (calcium for strong bones)
- **Beans, lentils, cowpeas** – cheap protein every day
- **Orange fruits & veg** – mango, papaya, carrots, pumpkin (vitamin A)
- **Liver** – once a week (best source of iron)
- **Groundnuts & seeds** – in porridge or as snack

One egg + one cup milk + handful mchicha = super protection for the day!

Chapter 4: Healthy Snacks (Say No to Bis.content:
### Best Snacks (give 2 daily)
- Fresh fruits (banana, orange pieces, mango)
- Boiled egg or groundnuts (small handful)
- Yogurt or fermented porridge
- Avocado slices or groundnut butter on bread
- Roasted maize or sweet potato
- Homemade popcorn (no sugar)

### Snacks to Stop Completely
- Sweet biscuits, cakes, crisps
- Soda, juice packets, ice-lollies
- Sweets and chocolate (destroy appetite and teeth)

Water or milk only for drinking – no juice or tea between meals.

Chapter 5: Easy Recipes Children Love.content:
### 1. Vegetable Rice
Cook rice with carrots, mchicha and dagaa → add little oil

### 2. Bean & Banana Mash
Mashed beans mixed with ripe banana → serve with vegetables

### 3. Egg Chapati Roll
Chapati with scrambled egg + tomatoes rolled inside

### 4. Power Porridge (morning or snack)
Maize + millet + groundnut powder + mashed fruit

### 5. Fish & Sweet Potato
Boiled or fried fish + boiled sweet potato + greens

Chapter 6: Feeding Challenges & Solution.content:
### Child Refuses Vegetables
→ Hide in ugali/rice, cut tiny, serve with egg or groundnuts first

### Only Wants Ugali or Rice
→ Mix beans/dagaa inside before serving

### Too Much TV/Phone While Eating
→ No screens at mealtime – eat together as family

### Wants Biscuits All Day
→ Remove them from the house completely – children eat what is available

### Small Appetite
→ Give 5 small meals instead of 3 big ones

Eat together, pray together, talk and laugh – children eat more when happy!

Chapter 7: Deworming, Vitamins & Clinic.content:
- Deworm every 6 months (from age 1)
- Vitamin A capsule every 6 months (clinic gives free)
- Go for growth check at least 4 times a year
- Vaccinations on time

Well-fed + dewormed children grow tall and learn fast at school.

Chapter 8: Warning Signs – Act Fast.content:
Take to hospital immediately if you see:
- Weight loss or no gain for 2–3 months
- Very pale palms or eyelids (anaemia)
- Swollen belly or feet
- Always tired or sleepy
- Hair becoming brown or falling
- Frequent illness or cough

These are signs of poor nutrition – can be fixed fast if caught early.

Conclusion.chapter_title: Conclusion: You Are Raising a Champion
Conclusion.content:
Every plate you give your 2–5 year old is building:
✓ A tall, strong body
✓ A clever brain ready for school
✓ Strong teeth and bones
✓ Protection from diseases
✓ Good eating habits for life

You don’t need money – you need these daily habits:

✓ 3 meals + 2 healthy snacks
✓ Egg or protein every day
✓ Green vegetable every day
✓ Fruit every day
✓ Milk every day
✓ Eat together as a family

Mama/Baba, what you do between 2–5 years decides if your child will be among the strongest and cleverest in class.

*Keep feeding with love – you are building the future leader of tomorrow!*
